body_html:
It does look like we can improve the (pretty) __str__ print.

On being able to reproduce the object with __repr__, I do find it very useful to be able to reproduce currently. That said, I'm not against:

  • Adding more information as long as it's still reproducible, i.e. we could always print the dtype, even if it's the default dtype. Or have an option.
  • Adding more information when the tensor isn't reproducible anyway, i.e. print a size if we are summarizing. It would be a little weird to sometimes have the size though, but I don't think that's a huge deal. Or we could add a size parameter to torch.tensor (that just checks it's correct), so it's still reproducible, although that's a little strange too.

Adding more information when the tensor isn't reproducible anyway, i.e. print a size if we are summarizing. body:
It does look like we can improve the (pretty) `__str__` print.

On being able to reproduce the object with `__repr__`, I do find it very useful to be able to reproduce currently.  That said, I'm not against:
* Adding more information as long as it's still reproducible, i.e. we could always print the dtype, even if it's the default dtype.  Or have an option.
* Adding more information when the tensor isn't reproducible anyway, i.e. print a size if we are summarizing.  It would be a little weird to sometimes have the size though, but I don't think that's a huge deal.  Or we could add a size parameter to `torch.tensor` (that just checks it's correct), so it's still reproducible, although that's a little strange too.
